common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to AVX2 incompatibility
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch after updating to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from hardware incompatibility with the AVX2 instruction set. The Pieces team acknowledged the problem and released a fix in version 11.1.2, resolving the launch issue for affected users.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User reported being unable to launch PiecesOS on macOS (Arm architecture) after updating to 11.1.0.
* Related issues were identified by the support bot, including other launch failures on macOS and M1 chips.
* The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and identified the root cause as a lack of AVX2 support on the user's CPU.
* A fix was implemented and released in version 11.1.2.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS wasn't launching on certain macOS systems with newer CPUs.
* The issue was related to the lack of AVX2 support on those CPUs.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team released a new version (11.1.2) that addresses the AVX2 issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of version 11.1.2.
* The user confirmed that the fix works for them.

**Additional Notes:**

* This conversation highlights the importance of providing detailed information about your system when reporting issues.
* It also demonstrates the Pieces team's commitment to resolving user issues promptly.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* GetReal444 reported an issue booting up the Pieces app.
* Mark-at-Pieces requested additional information for diagnosis and offered support via call.
* GetReal444 provided logs indicating an error message related to AVX2 requirement.
* Mark-at-Pieces acknowledged the issue and explained it affects multiple users.

**Problems identified:**

* The Pieces app was not booting up for some users due to an AVX2 hardware requirement.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team is actively working on a patch to resolve the issue.
* A workaround is to update to the latest version (11.1.2) of PiecesOS.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of PiecesOS version 11.1.2.
* GetReal444 confirmed that the app is working after the update.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue is related to a failing dependency of the AVX2 vector library on certain platforms.
* The Pieces team is actively working on a permanent solution.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

- User @DevWizard24 reported an issue with Pieces not launching.
- User @GetReal444 confirmed the same issue and provided instructions for collecting logs.
- Pieces support confirmed the issue and identified it as related to hardware requirements in version 11.1.1.
- A fix was planned for release within 24-48 hours.
- User @tsavo-at-pieces mentioned a related issue (#625).
- A release to mitigate the issue was planned for the next day.
- On February 14th, Pieces support requested an update from @DevWizard24 after updating to version 11.1.2.

**Problems Identified:**

- Pieces was not launching for some users.
- The issue was related to stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Collect logs from the user's computer.
- Release a patch to fix the issue within 24-48 hours.
- Release a mitigation update the next day.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- A fix was released in version 11.1.2.
- Pieces support is awaiting an update from the user after updating to the new version.

**Additional Notes:**

- The user can find more information about the issue in related issues #131, #620, and #456.
- They can also refer to the provided links for existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS boot-up failure due to core dependencies
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS getting stuck during startup, particularly on the "dependencies scenario" tab. This problem appears to be related to recent updates and stricter hardware requirements. Solutions include upgrading to the latest version (11.1.2), reinstalling PiecesOS, and waiting for a patch to address hardware compatibility.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation #613

**Key Points Raised:**

* Shamas-Habib is experiencing an issue where PiecesOS is stuck on the "dependencies scenario" tab and doesn't progress. They have tried several solutions, including reinstalling Windows and removing Atlas OS, but the issue persists.
* JasonDWilson is also experiencing an issue where PiecesOS won't fully start. He has updated to the latest version, but the os_server.exe process is still running without the systray icon appearing and PFD is unable to connect.
* Rogierlegit commented that the issue reported by Shamas-Habib is likely not related to his issue on MacOS Monterey.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS is taking a long time to boot up for Shamas-Habib.
* PiecesOS is not starting for JasonDWilson.
* The user identified as rogierlegit is experiencing a different issue on MacOS Monterey.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces recommended Shamas-Habib to wait for the issue to be resolved.
* Nathan-courtney-pieces suggested Shamas-Habib to uninstall and reinstall PiecesOS using a specific link. They also asked them to share screenshots of the related files.
* Mark-at-pieces announced that the issue has been resolved and asked Shamas-Habib to confirm if it is working.
* Mark-at-pieces suggested JasonDWilson to update to version 11.1.1.
* Mark-at-pieces identified that JasonDWilson's issue may be related to a long-standing issue with OneDrive and advised them to either reach out to support or remove the database if it is empty.
* Mark-at-pieces suggested rogierlegit to update to version 11.1.2 and report back.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Shamas-Habib confirmed that the issue is resolved after updating to version 11.1.1.
* JasonDWilson's issue is still unresolved and they are scheduled to have a call on Monday to discuss further.
* Rogierlegit's issue on MacOS Monterey is still unresolved and they are asked to update to version 11.1.2 and report back.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failures on macOS
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch on macOS after updating to version 11.1.1. The issue was attributed to hardware incompatibility, particularly on M1 chips and systems lacking AVX2 support. The Pieces team addressed the problem by releasing version 11.1.2, which includes fixes for these issues. Users experiencing launch problems are advised to upgrade to the latest version.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Summary of GitHub Issue #621

**Key points raised:**

* PASimmons reported an issue with PiecesOS not running on their Mac M1 chip.
* The support bot suggested related issues and resources.
* Mark, a Pieces support team member, provided troubleshooting steps involving:
    * Killing `pieces_qdrant_server` process
    * Sharing support logs
    * Verifying and reinstalling the correct Pieces version for their M1 chip

**Problems identified:**

* Initial installation of PiecesOS might not have been compatible with PASimmons' M1 chip.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Reinstalling the correct Pieces version for M1 architecture from the official website.

**Current status/outcome:**

* PASimmons confirmed successful resolution after reinstalling the proper version.
* Mark closed the issue and linked to an ongoing announcement about the issue.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Crashing on macOS after Update
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS crashing on macOS after updating to version 11.1.0 or 11.1.1. The issue was primarily observed on machines with Apple Silicon (M1, M2, etc.) and Intel CPUs lacking AVX2 support. The solution involved reinstalling from the correct download link for Apple Silicon or upgrading to version 11.1.2, which addressed the AVX2 compatibility issue.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

* The conversation took place on February 14, 2025.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving PiecesOS launch failures:** The most frequent and active support tickets revolve around PiecesOS failing to launch after the 11.1.1 update, particularly due to AVX2 incompatibility and issues on macOS. Focus on providing clear guidance for affected users, such as upgrading to 11.1.2 or reinstalling with the correct version for their architecture.

**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** The launch failures highlight the need for clearer communication about PiecesOS's hardware requirements. Update the documentation and installation instructions to prominently feature these requirements, potentially including a system check tool.

**Investigate and address PiecesOS boot-up issues:**  Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS getting stuck during boot-up, specifically on the "dependencies scenario" tab. Investigate the root cause of this problem and provide a timely resolution.

**Address high resource usage:** Some users report high RAM and CPU usage by PiecesOS. Investigate these reports, optimize resource utilization, and provide guidance on configuration options that could alleviate these issues.

**Review and improve macOS compatibility:** A significant number of issues originate from macOS users, particularly those with M1 chips. Dedicate resources to thoroughly test and ensure compatibility with various macOS versions and architectures.
